Package ec.co

package ec.co
The ec.co package contains combinatorial optimization (CO) algorithms and the components necessary to build them. Combinatorial optimization differs from other kinds of optimization and search in that algorithms for solving tasks in this domain often proceed by building up partial solutions (in our case, a list of Component objects) incrementally with the help of heuristic information. So while most of ECJ's algorithms can be applied to a Problem that just provides a fitness function for whole solutions, we need more than just a fitness function in order to apply ECJ's CO algorithms.

The ConstructiveProblemForm interface in this package defines the additional information that users must provide for combinatorial optimization problems.

Have a look at the the ec.app.tsp and ec.app.knapsack example apps to get a sense of how these components can be used in practice.

    Package
    Description
    ec
     
    ec.co.ant
    Ant Colony Optimization algorithms This package contains the components necessary to implement ACO algorithms, specifically the classic pair: Ant System and Ant Colony System.

  • Class
    Description
    Component
    A data structure that encodes a single candidate piece of a constructive solution.
    ConstructiveBreeder
    A basic Breeder that generates a new population by asking each subpopulation's Species to create new individuals.
    ConstructiveIndividual<T extends Component>
    Represents an Individual that can be incrementally constructed from a number of smaller components.
    ConstructiveProblemForm
    Defines a combinatorial optimization problem.
